column4: hi all. i've got an amd x2 3800+ processor and am having trouble installing ubuntu on it
i've tried to install but in the part where it gets to pick out the proper kernel it gives me an error that says and can't find a suitable kernel for the processor
i can't even boot with a live distro
isnt that when you are supposed to use the smp kernels? Not sure
i'm getting tired of running my sys on windows and i need a change
i did a complete change on my systems some months ago, has worked out great
from xp to ubuntu on all machines, i was tired of pressing yes and ok, activating and verifying all the time. All that ms bs
ah yes, that. i've done that to all of my systems except this one which i just bought not even a week ago
i'm sorry i dont know anything about the dual cores, have you tried a boot from knoppix to see if that works?
no. i'm affraid i'll just keep wasting cds. i've already wasted 5 trying to get a live distro to work. don't wanna keep that up you know
well, best advise i can give is a post on the ubuntuforums
